isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3200, 4200, 4300, 4400, 7300, 7400, 7500, 8500, 8600 - ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 3000FE, 3000RE - 3000FE CHASSIS ACCESSORIES - DESCRIPTION

svcsubproc.title: Horn
svcsubproc.para: The dual electric horns (high and low note), located on the front side of the left platform support, provide a means for the driver to signal or provide warning.

svcsubproc.title: Air Dryer with Heater
svcsubproc.para: The function of the air dryer is to collect moisture and contaminants in the air system before it reaches the first reservoir. This will provide for moisture-free air for the air brake system. The heater in the air dryer prevents freeze-up in the purge drain valve during cold weather.

svcsubproc.title: Antilock Brake System
svcsubproc.para: Refer to CTS-5115 ANTILOCK AIR BRAKE SYSTEM.

svcsubproc.title: Body Connections
svcsubproc.para: The purpose of the body connectors is to provide connections of the body lighting circuits and the chassis circuitry.

svcsubproc.title: Automatic Drain Valve with Heater
svcsubproc.para: The function of the automatic drain valve is to automatically expel accumulated moisture from the air tank. The heater in the drain valve prevents freeze-up during cold weather operation.

svcsubproc.title: Heated Fuel Filter/Water-In-Fuel
svcsubproc.para: The fuel filter heater is mounted in the fuel filter and when operating, it helps prevent fuel from gelling up in the unfiltered side of the filter. The system consists of a fuel heater relay, the filter heating element, and a normally open thermo switch. The switch contacts close at approximately 50°F (10°C).

The water-in-fuel system consists of a control module, a water probe, and a warning light in the dash cluster. When water is present in the fuel filter, increased current will flow from the probe to ground. The module senses this increase and turns on the warning light. The system also conducts a bulb check when the key switch is in the start position to verify the light operates.

svcsubproc.title: Hydraulic Brakes
svcsubproc.para: The Bendix Hydro-Max II hydraulic brake booster is offered on all hydraulic brake models. It powers a split system which protects against brake failure by using separate fluid lines to feed the front and rear axle brakes. The master cylinder provides fluid pressurized by the power steering pump and the Hydro-Max II booster to activate the brake pads against the disc brakes. It is a dual mode system which will automatically provide back-up brake power, from an electric/hydraulic pump, should there be a loss of power steering pump pressure.
A warning light and alarm, which can indicate various hydraulic and electrical malfunctions, are standard.

svcsubproc.title: Stop Light Switch (Air Brakes)
svcsubproc.para: The stop light switch circuit controls voltage to the body builder connector (169) and is used by the body builder stop light circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Allison AT Automatic Transmission
svcsubproc.para: With the Allison electrically controlled transmission, the shift modulator valve is controlled by the ECM. The system consists of a modulator solenoid relay and modulator shift solenoid. A neutral position switch is also provided to prevent the truck from being started in drive gear.

svcsubproc.title: Allison WTEC Transmission
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Troubleshooting Guide CTS-5264 for a description of the Allison WTEC transmission.
